result.execSummary:
The defendant Ashley L Aussem was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
IF REVOKED:
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
Consecutive to: Sentence in 21CF1906

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be determined at a later date.

*Costs and DNA Surcharge to be paid as a condition of probation
*If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment. 
*Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

*Cases 21CM1070, 22CF180, 22CM910, and 22CM1356 are dismissed and read in
 Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent
*No contact with Walmart store listed in this criminal complaint, the Meijer store and Co-Defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint in 22CF414, and Victim A in 22CM1356 with the exception of incidental contact in the WCJ as they are both currently in custody there.
*Avoid any person or place associated with the sale, distribution, or use of illegal controlled substances
*No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact with any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed
*Anger management to be determined by Agent
*AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended
*No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia
*Comply with random urine screens and maintain absolute sobriety
*No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription

records.addlTxt: Restitution hearing on November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:06 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ashley L Aussem in court, in custody at WCJ.  Attorney Anna M Kees in court for Ashley L Aussem.  Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Kees confirms the offer, she also notes there are concerns about Victim A in 22CM1356 being present for the entire hearing today.  Atty. Kees asks that the Victim be allowed to make her statements but then be disconnected from the call for the remainder of this hearing.  State notes these are public proceedings.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will allow Victim A, from 22CM1356, to remain on the call for the entire hearing.

Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 2, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 2.  Court orders Count 3 dismissed and read in.  Court also orders cases 21CM1070, 22CF180, 22CM910 & 22CM1356 dismissed and read into this case & 21CF1906.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Kees.
Victim A, from 22CM1356, makes statements.
Defendant presents statements.

COUNT 2:
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

3 Years Imprisonment (Consecutive to sentence in 21CF1906 IF revoked)
-	1 Year & 6 Months of Initial Confinement
-	1 Year & 6 Months of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program IF revoked.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program IF revoked.

Term of Probation: 3 Years

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision:
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	No contact with Walmart store listed in this Criminal Complaint, the Meijer store and Co-Defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint in 22CF414, and Victim A in 22CM1356 with the exception of incidental contact in the WCJ as they are both currently in custody there.
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
-	Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s;
-	No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
-	No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription
-	Avoid any person or place associated with the sale, distribution, or use of illegal controlled substances;
-	No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact with any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed;
-	Anger management to be determined by Agent.  

RESTITUTION: TBD at the restitution hearing set for 11/07/2022.

COSTS:  $278.00 (includes DRGOD surcharge);

DNA Surcharge: $250.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Restitution hearing scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

09:33 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Ashley L Aussem in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Anna M Kees.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Kees provides an update, with respect to the defendant's most recent case Pubic Defender needs time to appoint an attorney and State was not prepared to resolve that matter today as well.  With respect to all the other cases Atty. Will was not able to meet with her client to have the plea forms signed.  Atty. Kees requests a new plea and sentencing date.  State has no objection.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
